intro: Ixia patens, commonly known as the yellow daffodil, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of blooms in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are strap-shaped and grass-like, forming a basal rosette. Ixia patens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is well-suited to well-drained soils.
